TopicTitle: Regardless of my texture settings (Half-res or full-res) my textures are low-res

Articles.Content:
This was an issue before any mods were installed, but I do have mods installed now. I don't expect it has been affected though, so I decided it may be better posted here.

Regardless of my texture settings (Half-res or full-res) my textures look like this (words nearly unreadable, when they should be clear):

If I need to give any more information I'm happy to, I just wanted to get this posted before I went to bed, as I won't have access to my computer very much tomorrow.

Thanks in advance,

-Pingonaut

Edited January 13, 2015 by Pingonaut
Does reducing the texture quality below Half-Res change the appearance at all?

Does reducing the texture quality below Half-Res change the appearance at all?

No, it doesn't. I restarted after changing it as well, same result.

I'd be thinking perhaps KSP is unable to write to its settings.cfg file for some reason, then. Where is KSP installed? Steam/non-steam? Have you checked the permissions on the KSP folder (and subfolders & files) -- make sure they're not set to Read-Only, that you have ownership of them and Full Control permissions.

I'd be thinking perhaps KSP is unable to write to its settings.cfg file for some reason, then. Where is KSP installed? Steam/non-steam? Have you checked the permissions on the KSP folder (and subfolders & files) -- make sure they're not set to Read-Only, that you have ownership of them and Full Control permissions.

Saved to Steam, but Steam is saved on a separate partition. I've had it saved there before and it hasn't been a problem. Checked and it's not Read-only.

In the config the TEXTURE_QUALITY is set to 0.

EDIT: Fresh installed and had the same issue, but after restarting my game it's fixed. Thanks for the support!

Edited January 13, 2015 by Pingonaut
